column2: *The rock is just like you left it, sitting in the same spot. It seems like nothing has changed, but... not, some movie is playing on one of the research terminals. It seems like it's something from Hollywood's neoclassics. Like last time, the rock spots the visitor instantly.* Captain! Hello! You said you would come and you come! I wait!"
"Hello. Why did you wait?"
"So much to tell… Think so much… I know what is think! I know what is know!" *The movie is turned off, you can see a mess of pulsing colors on the screen again.* "It's all so unusual..."
"Last time I asked you to tell me about your people, you couldn't. Maybe you can do it this time?"
"Still, what are you? I know I've asked you about it, but you couldn't answer me."
"Tell me about your planet. You know what a planet is, right?"
"I guess this is enough for today."
*walk away*
"Yes… can't… now…" *A couple of lines of untranslated symbols.* "We are rocks, captain. Roll around. Live like that. It's all good and well."
"Who controls you? Do you have a leader?"
"So you just live like that? You roll around and… nothing else? Like wild animals?"
"I don't get it, do you have houses, cities… any kind of civilization?"
"You don't work the land, you don't mine resources, you don't live in tribes. It's very hard for me to process."
"I see. Let's talk about something else."
*The rock waits.*
"Last time I asked you to tell me about your people, you couldn't. Maybe you can do it this time?"
"Still, what are you? I know I've asked you about it, but you couldn't answer me."
"Tell me about your planet. You know what a planet is, right?"
"I guess this is enough for today."
*walk away*
"Control? Leader? What is a leader?"
"The boss."
"Why do I need a boss? I know what to do. I roll around, I live. Why a leader?"
"For everyone to have an easier life… or something like that. To divide up your responsibilities, work…"
*Untranslated words, a phrase.* "I don't understand. We roll around, it's all good and good. Why have a boss? No reason."
"Who controls you? Do you have a leader?"
"So you just live like that? You roll around and… nothing else? Like wild animals?"
"I don't get it, do you have houses, cities… any kind of civilization?"
"You don't work the land, you don't mine resources, you don't live in tribes. It's very hard for me to process."
"I see. Let's talk about something else."
"Animals? Bugs? No! We aren't bugs! We roll around!"
"No, no, you didn't get it. What makes you different from the bugs?"
"We aren't bugs! What are you saying?!"
"Hold up…"
*A paragraph of untranslated text.*
"Who controls you? Do you have a leader?"
"So you just live like that? You roll around and… nothing else? Like wild animals?"
"I don't get it, do you have houses, cities… any kind of civilization?"
"You don't work the land, you don't mine resources, you don't live in tribes. It's very hard for me to process."
"I see. Let's talk about something else."
"Civilization? What is civilization? I know what is a house and a city. Civilization?"
"Hard to explain. Basically, it's what you are and what you accomplished in the time that you are here."
*The rock is silent.*
"Okay, let's change the subject… Why don't you build anything?"
"Why? We live and roll around. Why house and city? Roll around the house and the city? Not enough room."
"Who controls you? Do you have a leader?"
"So you just live like that? You roll around and… nothing else? Like wild animals?"
"I don't get it, do you have houses, cities… any kind of civilization?"
"You don't work the land, you don't mine resources, you don't live in tribes. It's very hard for me to process."
"I see. Let's talk about something else."
"Yes. We just roll around, and all is good and all is well."
"But how? How can you live just… rolling around!"
"How not? We live like that. All is good and well."
"I'm not saying it's not. But you don't evolve, if you're right."          ß íå îòðèöàþ. Íî âåäü âû, åñëè òåáÿ ïîñëóøàòü, íå ðàçâèâàåòåñü."
"Why evolve? We just…"
"Nevermind, I know what you were going to say: you roll around."
"Yes!"
"Who controls you? Do you have a leader?"
"So you just live like that? You roll around and… nothing else? Like wild animals?"
"I don't get it, do you have houses, cities… any kind of civilization?"
"You don't work the land, you don't mine resources, you don't live in tribes. It's very hard for me to process."
"I see. Let's talk about something else."
"What is there to say? I am I. That is all."
"So what are you? What do you call yourselves? For example, we call ourselves people.
"Okay. You are you. Do you have a family?"
"In the last conversation you said you multiply through division. Did I understand you correctly?"
"Got it. Let's talk about something else."

*There is no answer for a long time, but it finally appears after that. First the world is untranslated, but then the translator manages to do it.* "People." *The translator gives you a helpful fact: every people's autonym can be translated as "people."* "And you are... HUMAN. I understand."
"Ahem. I see. In that case, I'll call you rocks."
"HUMANS and ROCKS. I like it."
"So what are you? What do you call yourselves? For example, we call ourselves people.
"Okay. You are you. Do you have a family?"
"In the last conversation you said you multiply through division. Did I understand you correctly?"
"Got it. Let's talk about something else."
"What is family?"
"Uhm… You could call it a voluntary union of two creatures created for domestic partnership, to bring up children, because of love."
"What is children?"
"Small creatures of your species. You know what a species is, right?"
"I know. But I'm small and I'm not children. I am I. Then I become bigger, like others, and still am I. But nevermind. I understand small bugs are not like big bugs. And what is love?"
"Oh. It's hard to explain. A deep connection to something or someone."
"Hm. I'm connected to this." *Obviously the rock means the science terminal.* "Are we in love?"
"No, you didn't understand me. If you felt tender emotions to the terminal, it would have been love. But as it is, you're just connected."
"Tender emotions?"
"Damn, it's so hard… don't ask me what "damn" means. Tender emotions... okay, let's put it this way: it's a strong connection to something, a desire for something. When you feel it, you're happy."
"What is happy?"
"Okay. That's it." I better ask Gordon to do it, I can't.
*The rock waits.*
"So what are you? What do you call yourselves? For example, we call ourselves people.
"Okay. You are you. Do you have a family?"
"In the last conversation you said you multiply through division. Did I understand you correctly?"
"Got it. Let's talk about something else."
"What? Yes. Someone divides and there are two different ones. One is him, the other is not him."
"And how does that happen?"
"Just crrrack! And that's it."
"Strange, but I imagined it all very clearly… ahem… okay. Let's talk about something else."
"Yes, I know. What do you want to know?"
"What is it like, your planet? Tell me about it."
"What is your planet called?"
"Except for you, only those bugs live on your planet?"
"I see. Let's talk about something else."
"Big. Who rolls far, does not come back. There is high ground, normal ground, low ground."
"I got you. Is that it? You don't know anything else?"
"I never roll far. Yes. Why? Don't know."
"Okay. There's something else."
"What? Nothing. Why? What is yours called?"
"We call it Earth."
"Earth?" *Untranslated random symbols. Laughter?* "Really, Earth? Strange name!"
"Better than nothing."
"Yes. Small. Crunch when you roll over them. No one else."
"What a weird ecosystem."
"Under the ground, others. They don't roll out onto the surface. If they don't want to, it's their business."
"And no one else? I see. I'll ask you something else."
"I'm tired… but it was good. I… I think I understand you. A bit."
"I think that's good."
"That's right… good…" *The screen goes dark. There are no new lines. The rock is asleep."
